page.title: 04The Moot Hall
page.content: At the{Moot Hall}there is a{library on the ground floor.On the first floor there is an exhibition of photos and pictures about the history of the village.The Moot Hall is also used for {parish council}meetings.It is a small two storey sixteenth century timber framed building standing on an island site, at the junction of Chapel Street and Church Street. The Moot Hall used to be the old village grammar school which was founded in 1592. Architecturally the building is of interest because of a good example of a dragon piece -part of the construction of a hipped roof. The key to the Moot Hall is kept at the P.O. so that visitors to the village can look at the exhibition. At present there is,on exhibit, a painted panel from the old Bower Hall, showing the Old Hall.
